span.title: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

name.value: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints

publisher.value: Boston's Children Hospital and Hl7 International

description.value: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

short.value: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints

definition.value: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

definition.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

short.value: Value of extension

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server. Required unless the implicit grant flow is used.

short.value: Value of extension

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: URL where an end-user can view which applications have access to data and make adjustments to these access rights.

definition.value: URL where an end-user can view which applications have access to data and make adjustments to these access rights.

short.value: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: Additional Content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

short.value: Value of extension

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: URL indicating the introspection endpoint that can be used to validate a token.

definition.value: URL indicating the introspection endpoint that can be used to validate a token.

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

short.value: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints

definition.value: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, it must be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

short.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

definition.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server. Required unless the implicit grant flow is used.

definition.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server.

short.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 dynamic registration endpoint for this FHIR server, if supported.

definition.value: URL indicating the OAuth2 dynamic registration endpoint for this FHIR server, if supported.

short.value: URL where an end-user can view which applications have access to data and make adjustments to these access rights.

definition.value: URL where an end-user can view which applications have access to data and make adjustments to these access rights.

short.value: URL indicating the introspection endpoint that can be used to validate a token.

short.value: URL indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.

definition.value: URL indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.
